Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw different land and water habitats, such as playgrounds, gardens, forests, ponds, or lakes.
The student can illustrate various types of plants found in each habitat, like trees, grasses, and flowers.
The student can depict different animals living in each habitat, such as squirrels, lizards, ants, fish, or birds.
The student can show how the types of plants and animals differ between habitats, highlighting biodiversity.
The student can use patterns in their drawings to show plant and animal diversity across the various habitats.
